name: Chicken Long Rice (Hawaiian-Style Chicken Soup)
author: Antonio
summary: This is my favorite dish of all time. This is also a great winter comfort food and great for flu season. Serve over steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package bean thread vermicelli noodles
3  chicken breasts, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Put bean thread noodles in a large bowl
Pour enough warm water over the noodles to cover by an inch
Soak noodles until softened, about 15 minutes; drain
Cut noodles into shorter lengths as desired
Put chicken breasts in a large pot with enough water to cover by a few inches; bring to a boil and cook chicken until until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 7 to 10 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
Remove chicken breasts to a cutting board and shred into strands with 2 forks; return shredded chicken to the pot of boiling water
Pour chicken broth into the pot and reduce heat to medium-high; add onion, garlic, ginger, fish sauce, soy sauce, and bay leaves; season with salt and pepper
Bring liquid again to a boil and add the bean thread noodles; cook at a boil until the noodles are translucent, about 5 minutes
Stir bok choy into the liquid; cook just until the leaves wilt slightly, 1 to 2 minutes
